titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Riley and James Russell, Verdict
CWG4292

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Jefferson Circuit Court
October Term 1863
October 26 1863

The Commonwealth Plff
versus } Indict felony
Jno Riley, James Russell Deft

We of the jury find the prisoner Jno Riley guilty as charged in the within indictment and say he shall be confined in the jail and penetentiary house of this Commonwealth two years and six months And we also find the prisoner James Russell guilty and say he shall be confined in the penitentiary of this Commonwealth One year and we recommend said Russell to Executive Clemency

and thereupon the
A Copy Att
Jas P Chambers c

To His Excellency,
Thomas E. Bramlette,
Governor of Kentucky:
I concur, with the Jury, in recommending the above named James Russell to Your Excellency's clemency.
